Origins: Although Joe Biden has been dubbed "gaffe prone" by some media outlets, one thing the current Vice President has not said is that the "Germans bombed Pearl Harbor," as suggested by a widely circulated meme:
Fact Check: Did Vice President Joe Biden say that the Germans bombed Pearl Harbor?
Description: The above-displayed image has been circulating online since at least 2012, when it was created to spoof a seemingly nonsensical tweet sent by @TheDemocrats: Shortly after @TheDemocrats sent out the above-referenced tweet, social media were flooded with faux nonsensical quotes supposedly issued by Joe Biden: It should also be noted that in March 2012, a few months before this Joe Biden meme was created, Minnesota congressman Keith Ellison did mistakenly state during a Fox News interview with Bill O'Reilly that the Germans had bombed Pearl Harbor: While it is likely that the creator of the meme was simultaneously mocking Ellison and Biden, it's also possible that the "Germans bombed Pearl Harbor" quote was inspired by John Belushi's famous and politically incorrect speech from the 1978 film comedy Animal House: Last updated: 28 August 2015
Example: [Collected via email, August 2015] A post on Facebook that indicated that Vice President Joe Biden said that the Germans bombed Pearl Harbor in a speech. Is there any truth to this?
Claim: Vice President Joe Biden said that the Germans bombed Pearl Harbor.
